intro: Pseudoselinum angolense, commonly known as Angolan false wormwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Pseudoselinum angolense is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
